metadata.description: Comprehensive mapping of the power transmission and motion control product landscape, covering major categories, specifications, manufacturers, and search patterns used by engineers and AI agents.

categories.name: Electric Motors
categories.description: Electromechanical devices that convert electrical energy into mechanical rotational energy. The foundational prime mover in virtually all industrial machinery, HVAC systems, pumps, conveyors, and automation equipment.

subcategories.name: AC Induction Motors (Asynchronous)
subcategories.description: The workhorse of industry. Uses electromagnetic induction from stator windings to induce current in the rotor. Available in squirrel-cage and wound-rotor configurations. Rugged, low maintenance, and cost-effective for constant-speed and variable-frequency drive applications.

subcategories.name: Servo Motors
subcategories.description: High-performance motors designed for precise control of position, velocity, and torque in closed-loop motion control systems. Typically permanent-magnet synchronous (PMSM) or brushless DC construction with integrated feedback devices (encoders/resolvers).

subcategories.name: DC Motors (Brushed)
subcategories.description: Motors powered by direct current, using brushes and a commutator for current switching. Provide excellent speed control characteristics. Being gradually replaced by AC drives in many applications but still widely used in legacy systems, battery-powered equipment, and specialty applications.

subcategories.name: Brushless DC Motors (BLDC / EC Motors)
subcategories.description: Electronically commutated motors using permanent magnets on the rotor and electronic switching instead of mechanical brushes. Offer high efficiency, long life, low noise, and compact size. Increasingly used in HVAC, automotive, and appliance applications.

power.label: Power Rating
power.description: Mechanical output power at rated speed and torque. NEMA standard uses HP; IEC standard uses kW.
power.typicalRange: 0.25 HP (0.18 kW) to 500 HP (375 kW) for general purpose; up to 20,000+ HP for large industrial

speed.label: Rated Speed / Synchronous Speed
speed.description: Full-load operating speed. Synchronous speeds for 60Hz are 3600, 1800, 1200, 900 RPM (2/4/6/8 pole). Actual speed is slightly less due to slip.
speed.typicalRange: 900 to 3600 RPM (standard); up to 30,000+ RPM for high-speed

voltage.label: Rated Voltage
voltage.description: Supply voltage at which the motor operates at rated performance. Common values depend on regional standards.

frameSize.label: Frame Size
frameSize.description: Standardized mounting dimensions. NEMA frames (56 through 5013) in North America; IEC frames (56 through 355+) internationally. Determines shaft height, bolt pattern, and shaft diameter.

efficiencyClass.label: Efficiency Class
efficiencyClass.description: Motor energy efficiency rating per international standards. Higher classes mean less electrical energy wasted as heat.

values.IE2: High Efficiency (equivalent to NEMA Energy Efficient)

enclosure.label: Enclosure Type
enclosure.description: Mechanical protection and cooling method. Determines suitability for different environments.

values.TEFC: Totally Enclosed Fan Cooled - most common industrial enclosure, suitable for dirty/dusty/outdoor environments
values.ODP: Open Drip Proof - allows air circulation, for clean indoor environments only
values.TENV: Totally Enclosed Non-Ventilated - sealed, no external fan, for small motors or hazardous locations
values.TEBC: Totally Enclosed Blower Cooled - external blower for variable speed applications
values.TEAO: Totally Enclosed Air Over - designed for airstream mounting (fans/blowers)
values.XPFC: Explosion Proof Fan Cooled - for hazardous (classified) locations

mounting.label: Mounting Configuration
mounting.description: How the motor is physically mounted to the driven equipment or structure.

insulation.label: Insulation Class
insulation.description: Maximum allowable winding temperature. Higher class allows operation at higher ambient temperatures or at higher loads.

serviceFactory.label: Service Factor
serviceFactory.description: Multiplier indicating how much above nameplate HP the motor can continuously deliver under certain conditions. Common values are 1.0 (IEC) and 1.15 (NEMA).

dutyCycle.label: Duty Cycle
dutyCycle.description: Operating pattern the motor is rated for.

categories.name: Gearboxes / Speed Reducers
categories.description: Mechanical power transmission devices that reduce speed and multiply torque from a prime mover (typically an electric motor) to a driven load. Essential for matching motor output characteristics to application requirements.

subcategories.name: Helical Gear Reducers
subcategories.description: Use helical (angled) gear teeth for smooth, quiet operation and high efficiency (96-98% per stage). Available as inline (parallel shaft) or right-angle (helical-bevel) configurations. The most common industrial gear reducer type.

subcategories.name: Worm Gear Reducers
subcategories.description: Use a worm (screw) meshing with a worm wheel. Compact, high ratio in single stage (5:1 to 100:1), and inherently non-backdrivable at high ratios. Lower efficiency than helical (50-90% depending on ratio). Cost-effective for moderate duty.

subcategories.name: Planetary (Epicyclic) Gear Reducers
subcategories.description: Multiple planet gears orbit a central sun gear inside a ring gear. Extremely compact, high torque density, high efficiency, coaxial input/output. Preferred for servo applications and where space is limited.

subcategories.name: Bevel / Helical-Bevel Gear Reducers
subcategories.description: Use bevel gear sets to provide right-angle shaft orientation. Often combined with helical stages for higher ratios. Spiral bevel teeth provide smooth, efficient operation.

gearRatio.label: Gear Ratio
gearRatio.description: Input speed divided by output speed. Determines speed reduction and torque multiplication.

outputTorque.label: Output Torque
outputTorque.description: Maximum continuous torque available at the output shaft under rated conditions.

inputSpeed.label: Input Speed
inputSpeed.description: Maximum rated input speed, typically matched to motor speed.

outputSpeed.label: Output Speed
outputSpeed.description: Resulting speed at the output shaft (input speed / gear ratio).

serviceFactor.label: Service Factor (SF)
serviceFactor.description: Safety factor applied based on application shock loading and operating hours. Typically 1.0 to 2.5+. Higher values for heavy shock loads (crushers, mills).

mountingPosition.label: Mounting Position
mountingPosition.description: Orientation of the gearbox in the installation. Affects lubrication, sealing, and thermal performance.

thermalRating.label: Thermal Power Rating
thermalRating.description: Maximum input power the gearbox can continuously dissipate as heat without exceeding oil temperature limits. May be lower than mechanical rating in high-ambient or enclosed installations.

efficiency.label: Efficiency
efficiency.description: Percentage of input power transmitted to the output. Varies by gear type and ratio.

backlash.label: Backlash
backlash.description: Lost motion between input and output due to gear tooth clearances. Critical for precision positioning applications.

categories.name: Roller Chain
categories.description: Mechanical power transmission chain consisting of alternating roller links and pin links. One of the most common and cost-effective methods of transmitting power between parallel shafts. Defined by ANSI B29.1 (US) and ISO 606 (international) standards.

subcategories.name: Standard Roller Chain
subcategories.description: General purpose ANSI standard chain available in single, double, triple, and quadruple strand. The most common type used in industrial power transmission. Chain numbers indicate pitch in eighths of an inch (e.g., #40 = 4/8 inch = 0.500 inch pitch).

subcategories.name: Heavy Series Roller Chain
subcategories.description: Same pitch as standard but with thicker side plates, larger diameter pins, and wider rollers for increased fatigue resistance and shock load capacity. Designated by 'H' suffix (e.g., 60H, 80H).

subcategories.name: Double Pitch Roller Chain
subcategories.description: Same roller diameter and pin configuration as standard chain but with twice the pitch (link plate length). Lighter weight and lower cost for applications that can accommodate larger sprockets. Uses 2000-series numbering (e.g., C2040, C2050).

subcategories.name: Conveyor / Attachment Chain
subcategories.description: Modified roller chain with extended pins, tabs, or attachments for moving product along a conveyor path. Available with K, SA, SK, A, and other attachment styles per ANSI standards.

pitch.label: Pitch
pitch.description: Distance between pin centers on adjacent links. The fundamental dimensional characteristic.

chainNumber.label: ANSI Chain Number
chainNumber.description: Standard chain designation per ANSI B29.1. First digit(s) indicate pitch in 1/8 inch increments. Last digit: 0=standard roller, 5=rollerless (bushing chain).

tensileStrength.label: Minimum Ultimate Tensile Strength
tensileStrength.description: The minimum force at which the chain will break in a static pull test. Design load should be well below this value.

workingLoad.label: Working Load / Design Capacity
workingLoad.description: Maximum recommended continuous load, typically 1/6 to 1/10 of tensile strength depending on speed and conditions.

numberOfStrands.label: Number of Strands
numberOfStrands.description: Single, double, triple, or quadruple strand. Multiple strands increase load capacity roughly proportional to the number of strands.

rollerDiameter.label: Roller Diameter
rollerDiameter.description: Outside diameter of the rollers. Affects sprocket tooth profile and contact stress.

chainWidth.label: Width Between Inner Plates
chainWidth.description: Internal width of the chain. Must match sprocket tooth width.

categories.name: Timing Belts (Synchronous Belts)
categories.description: Toothed belts that mesh positively with grooved pulleys to provide zero-slip power transmission with precise speed synchronization. Combine the flexibility and quiet operation of belts with the positive engagement of chains and gears. Used extensively in packaging, printing, robotics, and linear motion.

subcategories.name: HTD (High Torque Drive)
subcategories.description: Curvilinear tooth profile developed by Gates Rubber Company. Provides higher load-carrying capacity than classical trapezoidal profiles. Available in 3M, 5M, 8M, 14M, and 20M pitches (metric, in mm). Widely used in general industrial power transmission.

subcategories.name: GT / GT3 / GT5 (Gates PowerGrip GT)
subcategories.description: Improved curvilinear tooth profile by Gates. Offers 30%+ higher load capacity than HTD in the same belt size. Modified ogival tooth shape improves load distribution. Available in 2M, 3M, 5M, 8M, and 14M pitches. Current industry standard for new designs.

subcategories.name: AT (Advanced Technology) / Polyurethane Timing Belts
subcategories.description: Polyurethane belts with steel or Kevlar tension members. AT profiles include AT3, AT5, AT10, AT20 pitches. Superior wear resistance, chemical resistance, and precision compared to rubber belts. Often used in linear motion and positioning. Manufactured by extrusion for seamless (endless) or by welding for custom lengths.

subcategories.name: Classical Trapezoidal (MXL, XL, L, H, XH, XXH)
subcategories.description: Original timing belt profiles with trapezoidal (straight-sided) teeth. Legacy standard still widely used. Imperial pitch designations. Lower load capacity than curvilinear profiles but massive installed base and wide availability.

pitch.label: Tooth Pitch
pitch.description: Distance between adjacent tooth centers. Fundamental specification that determines belt/pulley compatibility.

width.label: Belt Width
width.description: Width of the belt. Wider belts carry more load. Must match pulley width.

numberOfTeeth.label: Number of Teeth
numberOfTeeth.description: Total number of teeth on the belt. Determines the belt length (pitch x teeth = pitch length).

beltLength.label: Pitch Length
beltLength.description: Total length of the belt measured at the pitch line (the neutral axis where the tension members sit).

material.label: Belt Material
material.description: Body and tooth material. Determines operating environment suitability.

temperatureRange.label: Operating Temperature Range
temperatureRange.description: Acceptable ambient and belt surface temperature range for continuous operation.
temperatureRange.typicalRange: -30C to +85C (rubber), -30C to +80C (standard PU), up to +130C (special compounds)

maxLinearSpeed.label: Maximum Belt Speed
maxLinearSpeed.description: Maximum recommended belt velocity. Limited by centrifugal effects and tooth engagement dynamics.
maxLinearSpeed.typicalRange: Up to 60 m/s for rubber HTD/GT, up to 80 m/s for special designs

categories.name: Bearings
categories.description: Precision mechanical components that constrain relative motion between two parts to only the desired motion, while reducing friction. Bearings support rotating shafts, allow linear motion, or provide pivoting capability. The most widely used precision component in all machinery.
commonUseCases: Wind turbine main shafts and gearboxes
Rolling mill work rolls and backup rolls

subcategories.name: Deep Groove Ball Bearings
subcategories.description: The most common bearing type worldwide. Supports radial loads and moderate axial loads in both directions. Low friction, high speed capability. Available from miniature (1mm bore) to large (300mm+ bore). The default choice when loads are moderate and primarily radial.

subcategories.name: Cylindrical Roller Bearings
subcategories.description: Use cylindrical rollers for high radial load capacity in a compact design. Higher radial capacity than same-size ball bearings. Various internal configurations (NU, NJ, NUP, N) provide different combinations of axial constraint. High-speed capability.

subcategories.name: Tapered Roller Bearings
subcategories.description: Use tapered (conical) rollers to support combined radial and axial loads. Always used in pairs (opposing arrangement) to handle axial loads in both directions. Require preload adjustment during installation. Separable inner/outer races for easy mounting.

subcategories.name: Spherical Roller Bearings
subcategories.description: Self-aligning bearing with barrel-shaped rollers on a spherical outer ring raceway. Accommodates shaft misalignment and deflection (up to 2-3 degrees). Very high radial load capacity and moderate axial capacity. Used in heavy, dirty, misalignment-prone applications.

boreDiameter.label: Bore Diameter (d)
boreDiameter.description: Inner ring bore diameter that fits on the shaft. The primary sizing dimension.

outerDiameter.label: Outer Diameter (D)
outerDiameter.description: Outside diameter of the outer ring. Determines housing bore size.

dynamicLoadRating.label: Basic Dynamic Load Rating (C)
dynamicLoadRating.description: The constant radial load under which a group of identical bearings will achieve a basic rating life of 1 million revolutions. Used for fatigue life calculations (L10 life).

staticLoadRating.label: Basic Static Load Rating (C0)
staticLoadRating.description: The static radial load that produces a combined permanent deformation of 0.0001 times the roller diameter at the most heavily loaded contact. Used for stationary or slow-speed applications.

speedRating.label: Limiting Speed / Reference Speed
speedRating.description: Maximum recommended operating speed with grease or oil lubrication. Depends on bearing type, size, precision, and lubrication.

sealing.label: Seal / Shield Configuration
sealing.description: Type of integral sealing to retain lubricant and exclude contaminants.

commonValues.Open: No seals or shields - requires external sealing and lubrication system
commonValues.2Z / ZZ: Metal shields on both sides - non-contact, allow higher speed
commonValues.2RS / 2RS1: Rubber contact seals on both sides - good sealing, slight friction
commonValues.2RZ: Non-contact rubber seals - compromise between Z and RS

precision.label: Tolerance Class / Precision Grade
precision.description: Manufacturing precision of dimensional and running accuracy.

internalClearance.label: Internal Clearance
internalClearance.description: Total radial or axial play between inner ring, rolling elements, and outer ring before mounting. Affects running clearance after press fit and thermal expansion.

values.C2: Less than Normal - for precision applications
values.C3: Greater than Normal - for press fits and temperature
values.C4: Even greater - for large temperature differentials
